title: Easy Baked Ham Steaks Recipe
description: This baked ham steak recipe makes a quick and easy dinner that satisfies the whole family. Serve it with potatoes or mac and cheese for a tasty meal.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Main Dishes Pork Ham Brown Sugar Easy Baked Ham Steaks 4.3 (67) 53 Reviews 4 Photos Quick and easy baked ham steak recipe for any day of the week. Goes great with scalloped potatoes or mac and cheese. Also great in the slow cooker. Submitted by chrissy_592 Updated on July 12, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 4 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 35 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 2 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings 1 cup water, or more as needed 3 tablespoons brown sugar 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce 5 whole cloves 2 slices ham steak Directions Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Mix water, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, and cloves in a baking dish. Arrange ham steaks in baking dish, coating with sugar mixture. Add more water as needed to cover ham. Bake in the preheated oven until ham is tender, 35 to 45 minutes. I Made It Print 180 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Baked Ham Steaks 01 of 04 Photo by  deb391 02 of 04 Photo by  Danielle K 11/12/2022 Sweet and savory ham. We liked it a lot! 03 of 04 Photo by  deb391 04/04/2021 04 of 04 Photo by  Melissa Conger 02/10/2013 It smelled sooooo good cooking and I wanted to love it, but alas, it didn't work for me. I used the smallest bake dish the ham would fit into so I wouldn't have to dilute the flavors with lots of additional water needed to cover the ham, but the flavors (although good) were still muted. As the ham baked, it curled up above the cooking liquid. I flipped it over while cooking, but it still turned out dry. Perhaps covering the bake dish with foil would prevent the ham from drying out, or double the initial brown sugar/Worcestershire/clove mix. 1 You’ll Also Love Brown Sugar Ham Steak 191 Ratings Crazy Good Southern Baked Ham Easy Tasty Ham Steaks with Maple Glaze for Two 37 Ratings Slow Cooker Ham and Beans 163 Ratings Quick and Easy Ham with Sweet Potatoes 92 Ratings Pittsburgh Style Chipped Ham Barbeque 18 Ratings Pittsburgh Ham Barbecue Sandwich 11 Ratings Parmesan Crusted Pork Chops 455 Ratings Sweet and Spicy Ham Steak 5 Ratings Quick Pineapple Ham Steaks 4 Ratings Pork Chops in Red Sauce 95 Ratings Garlic Baked Ham 2 Ratings Lavender Pork Steaks 12 Ratings My Great Grandmother's Ham Croquettes 7 Ratings Mini Ham Loaves 13 Ratings Ham and Mac Bake 3 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: chrissy_592
instructions: Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).;Mix water, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, and cloves in a baking dish. Arrange ham steaks in baking dish, coating with sugar mixture. Add more water as needed to cover ham.;Bake in the preheated oven until ham is tender, 35 to 45 minutes.
